message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC. 

The paper focuses on the problem of robot awareness of human actions, which is a core research problem in robotics. The proposed approach uses depth sensors for 3D perception and skeletal data to identify discriminative body parts and features. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Robotics (cs.RO), Computer Vision (cs.CV), and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper formulates the problem as a regression-like optimization problem, which indicates that it may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach in practical assistive living applications, which suggests that it may also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category.
